Function:

Plot the metrics on the graph

Parameters:

  • networkGraphs (NetworkGraphs) – Network graphs

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe with the metrics

  • filename (str) – Name of the file to be saved

Returns:

Pyvis plot

Return type:

pyvis.network.Network

  • filename (str) – Filename

src.visualisation_src.ML_visualisation.generate_static_cluster(networkGraphs, df_, filename, algo, layout_='map', nbr=0)[source]
Function:

Generate static cluster

Parameters:

  • networkGraphs (NetworkGraphs) – Network graphs

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe

  • filename (str) – File name

  • algo (str) – Algorithm

  • layout (str) – Layout

  • nbr (int) – Number of clusters

Returns:

Plotly plot

src.visualisation_src.metrics_visualisation.generate_static_metric(networkGraphs, df_, filename, layout_='map')[source]
Function:

Plot the metrics on the graph

Parameters:

  • networkGraphs (NetworkGraphs) – Network graphs

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Dataframe with the metrics (first column is the node id) (second column is the metric)

  • filename (str) – Name of the file to be saved

  • layout (str) – Layout to be used

Returns:

Plotly plot
